structure looked a lot like the application you would have to go through to do a change to the shopping cart on

had a very big blast radius and we took a look at it and realized that we needed
to move to a more of a micro services architecture and decouple all of the individual components of the amazon.com
retail site so now if you went to the homepage of amazon.com there's going to be the search bar and that's one team
and then the shopping cart is another team and then the pictures and the images all the content those are gonna
be different teams and when we were breaking up the services we realized we had to break up our culprit or corporate
structure as well so we had a monolithic application and we kind of had some monolithic teams we took our teams and
we turned them into what are called to Pizza teams it's what we refer to I mean internally at Amazon and the idea is
that no team is bigger than what can be fed with two pizzas and not those you
know little fancy pizzas pay $20 for that have arugula like a legit New York Pizza like to teen or two
people or write a team that can be fed by two pizzas and this started to work
